detailsOfAchievement: Since the establishment of the Inner Eye Foundation, the recognized missions have been pursued in the effective manner to supply the services for the target people towards under privileged people in the society. To achieve the soul purpose of the Foundation, the missions are being carried out to provide humanitarian assistance for the under privileged people especially poor and parent less children, women and old age people, the followings are its activities or programmes since May, 2016, on Livlihood, Education, Healcare and Disaster Relief Operation. Food Programme Under the Livelihood Mission, this programme is established to supply food accessories or commodities to the poor family which is lack of significant family income to survive day to day life. Till date, two individual families have been benefited from this Programme for short periods by receiving rice, oil, wheat and other commodities. Educational Programme The aims of the programme, under the Education Mission, to recognize poor school children in government schools and other organization in which children are accommodated for education to encourage them to travel to school buildings. 1. The Inner Eye recognized and provided its assistance to the Karnataka Welfare Association for Blind, Bangalore by providing Braille writing and reading sheet for those 112 children for 4 months with addition of medicines for 1 month under Health Mission. 2. It is providing continuous support for the TA Higher Primary School, Subedar Palya, Yeshwanthpur for those poor students supplying study materials, tools, school uniform. 3. The 36 orphan children in the Sadhana Education and Charitable Trust, Triveni Road, Yeshwanthpur have been distributed school uniforms under the Education and Cloth programme as it is our partial support for them. 4. The Ariviyal Solai Innovation Society, Bangalore has received contribution to conduct the Ariviyal Solai Science Career 2016 in the month of September at the Americal College, Madurai. 5. On 20th, December, 2016, the one day conference the Science and Technology Conference 2016 was organized by the Sacred Heart College, Tirupattur, Tamil Nadu State with the organization support of the Inner Eye Foundation, Tamil Nadu Science and Technology Centre, Government of Tamil Nadu and Rotary Club, Tirupattur, for the rural college students in the domain of Science. Cloth Bank and Distribution Programme On 22nd October, 2016, the Inner Eye conducted the programme of Cloth Bank and Distribution for poor people to supply used cloths. From this program, more than 25 families have been benefited. Programme on Fire Prevention and Fire Fighting Under the Disaster Relief Operation, the team of the DRO attended the 3 Days Training Programme on Fire Prevention and Fire Fighting, from 05.12.2016 to 07.12.2016, which was given by the RA Mundkur Fire Emergency Service Academy, Bangalore. The purpose of the programme to train our team member i.e. how to provide our service for the people on the emergency site when they meet natural calamities and disaster.

detailsOfAchievement: IRADS Akki-Alur, since its inception on 1994 has been carrying out awareness building programmes with respect to animal and human health activities as a well as we conducted 23 health camps since its birth. It has been trying to educate the weaker sections of societies including landless and marginalized people. The activities have been confining to the rural villages and around Akki-Alur of Hanagal Taluk. IRADS plan to extend its social welfare programmes in the form of seminars and street plays long back. It organized AIDS JANA JARAUTHI in 1998 at Hangal and AIDS  ONDU MARAKA ROGA at Akki-Alur in 2000. Our institution is aim to serve the people irrespective of caste creed religion and sex by creating employment to the unemployed youths in villages. IRADS plan to take up the AIDS prevention scheme in a totally systematic way. It has got its own strategy in its implementation. In the beginning IRADS plans to conduct awareness-building programmes in the specified areas of operation. Unless and until a proper awareness of the hazards of AIDS is brought about it is difficult to achieve any goal. IRADS plans to conduct awareness building through posters, pamphlets, street plays and video shows apart from wall painting and Jathas, which gives a general outline of the purpose of the project. In the second stage they will be given seminars on the use of condoms and other preventive measures to keep AIDS away from them. This could be of course achieved only after the formation of community based organizations like self help groups involving sex workers, Migrating workers, Truck Drivers, Homosexuals and Drug addicts for the identification of the vulnerable groups, we might have to conduct a base line survey. After the formation of CBOs they will be given trainings in income generating activities, to have a sustainable income. The children of those HIV affected women will be given education through Child Education Team (CET), IRADS also plans to provide housing facilities to those people through various governmental schemes and slowly they would be brought in to the mainstream. IRADS Akki-Alur has got an excellent infrastructure facilities and a team of expert dedicated staff to face any challenge and can raise to any occasion. Our vice president Mr. Rajashekhar Kallammanavar is a Rotarian by himself and has participated in several. Health Camps conducted with a joint venture of rotary club, Haveri apart from this one of our staff members have undergone a training on HIV, HIGH RISK ACTIVITY RESEARCH PROJECT in ballary from SWASTHI organization. On top of all we have a expert team of health consultants in from of doctors, nurses, lab technicians and pharmacists. Who have a rich experience in conducting programmes for the common people. IRADS and JSS Karwar (JAN SHIKSHAN SAMSTHAN) as combined with the tailoring class in YATHTHINAHALLI and ARASHINAGUPPI villages in Hangal Taluk of Haveri District. IRADS and JSS Karwar has combined with the motor rewinding programme in Akki-Alur Hanagal Taluk of Haveri District. JSS & IRADS are shortly started with TWO WHEELER SERVICE TRAINING PROGRAMME in Akki-Alur Hanagal Taluk of Haveri District. address: 294/22, 7th Cross Road, 1st Block Jayanagar, Bengaluru-560011,INDIA
title: International Competence Centre For Organic Agriculture
detailsOfAchievement: International Competence Centre for Organic Agriculture (ICCOA) Activities Achievements- works with a mandate to promote organic agriculture. Projects and Programs Cluster Development; Certification and Market Linkages: ICCOA has long experiences of developing farmer clusters in various regions/states. It works in collaboration with Dept. of Horticulture, Dept. of Agriculture, and through the supporting schemes of NHM, TMNE, RKVY, PKVY, MOVCD etc. C-SOF: CENTRE FOR SUSTAINABLE & ORGANIC FARMING: A 10.5 acre land is being set up by ICCOA as a Sustainable and Organic Bio-Village Model by integrating Agriculture, Horticulture and Allied Systems. The centre has been established for demonstration, training and applied research on all aspects of organic agriculture. This centre is based in Kolatti village, 17 Kms from Denkanikota, and 75 kms from Bangalore. RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY i. System Comparison and Participatory Research, 2005-06. Scientific study/research on System Comparison between organic farming system and conventional farming systems was conducted on cotton and its intercrop/rotation crops during 2003-2005. ii. Research Project MoU with Govt. of Sikkim, 2009-2012:- ICCOA has signed a MoU for a Research project on Technology Intervention in Organic farming through System Comparison and development of Organic Package of Practices with the Govt. of Sikkim. iii. Research and Survey on Marketing of Organic Products: Market research on organic products was conducted by ICCOA in 2006 and published as The Market for Organic Foods in India. This study is a benchmark for market potential and is referred to in many international publications/articles. MARKET DEVELOPMENT WORKS i. Created market linkages for various Organic projects with many leading companies in India and abroad ii. ICCOA also has technical collaboration and partnerships with international organizations e.g. IFOAM, FiBL, NurnbergMesse TRADE FAIR, B2B AND INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE SERIES ICCOA has been instrumental in facilitating trade and marketing of organic agricultural produce from India by organizing Indias biggest and exclusive annual event on organic agribusiness famously known as the India Organic Trade Fairs. Since 2008, this fair became the Biofach India together with India Organic International Trade Fair as ICCOA entered into an MOU with NumbergMesse of Germany. POLICY AND ADVOCACY i. ICCOA is member on various committees for national and state policies on sustainable agriculture formed at the Centre through the Ministry of Agriculture and State Govts. ii. ICCOA is on the advisory committee of state policy on organic farming of state governments of Himachal Pradesh, Sikkim, Nagaland, and Tamil Nadu. iii. ICCOA is invited by the Confederation of Indian industries (CII) to be on the National Committee On Rural Development (NCORD) iv. Mr. Manoj Kumar Menon, Executive Director, ICCOA was elected as Vice President IFOAM-Asia in the elections recently held in Seoul, South Korea.

detailsOfAchievement: JSS Mahavidyapeetha a registered society in 1962 has established more than 300 institutions, 1 university under UGC and private university under State Government with overseas present in Dubai, Mauritius, USA. JSSMVP for administrative purpose has the following divisions looking after various aspects of socio-economic activities: 1. General Education 2. Medical Education 3. Technical Education 4. Vocational Education 5. Supportive Institutions 6. Literature & Cultural Centres 7. Civil Works 8. Overseas division The divisions of JSSMVP have received awards and recognitions at State and National levels. The technical division in particular implementing JSS Mysore Urban Haat and DCH activities has received various awards recognitions with details as under: i) JSS RUDSETI  Award by Ministry Rural Development, GOI-2012 ii) JSS RUDSETI  Award by Ministry Rural Development, GOI-2013 iii) JSS RUDSETI  Award by Ministry Rural Development, GOI-2014 iv) JSS Polytechnic for the Differently Abled, Mysuru  National Award from President of India from Ministry of Social Justice & empowerment, GOI as BEST INSTITUTION. v) Certificate of appreciation has been awarded to JSS Mahavidyapeetha for effectively using CST System for community cooking in our educational institutions for the year 2016 in the National Workshop CS Technologies in Solar Cookers by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy, GOI on 29.04.2016 in New Delhi. vi) Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering  Science & Technology Entrepreneurs Park (SJCE-STEP), Mysore  Awarded as BEST-STEP during the year 2001 with cash award of Rs.1.00 lakh from Dept. of Science & Technology, Govt. of India. vii) JSS Academy of Technical Education - Science & Technology Entrepreneurs Park (JSSATE-STEP), Noida  Awarded as BEST-STEP during the year 2004 from Dept. of Science & Technology, Govt. of India. Our associate with M/s.AEC Corporation has been awarded BEST EXPORTER for paper handicrafts in Chamarajanagar backward District by Honble Chief Minister, Govt. of Karnataka in the year 2015-16. JSSMVP has provided infrastructural and mobilisation of rural women from backward areas of Chamarajanagar District. JSS Mysore Urban Haat is established under PPP model with the following pattern as per : 1. Grant from DCH Rs. 68.60 lakhs 2. Grant from DC (Handlooms) Rs. 68.60 lakhs 3. Grant from GOK Rs. 30 lakhs 4. Contribution from JSSMVP Rs. 28 lakhs plus Rs. 172 lakhs = Rs. 2 Crores JSSMVP has provided not only scheme funds but also met escalation cost of Rs. 172 lakhs in addition to providing 5 acres of land as contribution. JSSMUH is one of the few urban haats functioning in the country and is only urban haat set up under PPP model with private initiatives.

title: KAISHIKI NATYAVAHINI
detailsOfAchievement: Kaishiki Natyavahini a centre for Research and development of Dance, Music and Yoga, was established in the year 1989 by Guru Dr. Mala Shashikanth. Features of Kaishiki Natyavahini  Kaishiki Natyavahini is providing value oriented cultural education which enhances the character and intellect of the student.  With an aim to mould the tender minds, along with Bharatanatya, training is provided for students in Music  Vocal & Instruments, , Sanskrit Shlokas, Yoga- which establishes an intimate link between asanas of Yogashastra & karanas of Bharatanatya.  Studies at Natyavahini are rooted in Ashtanga with emphasis on Moral & Ethical living, training in Yama, Niyama Asanas, Mudras & Pranayama leading to an integrated development of both body & mind.  Natyavahini is organizing many platforms for students performance and training them to excel in this field.  The ultimate goal of Natyavahini is to help the students to niche for themselves in the dancing world. 25 years Milestones of progress :  Production of Dance  dramas / Dance features.  Highlighting the dance traditions of Karnataka.  Conducting Thyagaraja / Vaggeyakaras Aradhanas.  Programmes in Dance / Music, Lecturers and Demonstrations.  Samskrutha Shibhiras. During the period of twenty five years Kaishiki Natyavahini has grown into a prestigious institution by winning the recognition of Central and State Governments, besides the support of numerous commercial houses from all over India. It has to its credit in the field of research and training, it has developed into a prominent cultural centre of Jayanagar, Bangalore.  Delineating the lyrical beauty of ancient classics by poets Harihara and Kumaravyasa.  Production of a dance feature Paramparadhara with the theme revolving round the evolution of classical dance in Karnataka. Profoundly impressed by this work, the Government of Karnataka sponsored a chain display of Paramparadhara all over Karnataka.  Identifying and bringing together of prevalent dance substyles of Karnataka on a common platform under the project Karnataka Nruthya Sangama.  Honouring the veterans who have rendered staunch service to the preservation and promotion of the Mysore School of Bharatanatya. Plans :  To grant scholarship to the deserving students.  To conduct dance appreciation programmes in educational and cultural institutions.  Instituting awards to the talented upcoming artists.  To organize short term specialized courses in Abhinaya.  To build a new repertoire including the ancient items of dance compositions.

detailsOfAchievement: The Trust has been successfully conducted various activities. (a) The Trust has started a Fine Arts Institution under the same name and has established 13 branches across T.Narasipura, Talakadu, Chamaraja nagar, Alanahalli, Mysore and Bangalore, wherein Bharathanatyam is taught exclusively. (b) The Institution also has Music classes in T. Narasipur and Mysore. (c) Students of the Institution have been attending Examination conducted by the Karnataka State Secondary Education Board. (d) The Trained students of the Institution have been given a very good exposures such as Participation in National and State level festivals and competitions. (e) The Teachers of the Institution have been invited by other cultural associations like Allamaprabhu University, Gurudeva lalitha kala academy to conduct Workshops on Thala laya (f) The Trust has conducted Music Workshops in association with Brahma vidya Trust. (g) One of the teachers of the Institution is teaching Dance for - Physically challenged kids in Mysore, this is one of the appreciable activities of the Trust. (h) It is also having Library which consists music and dance related books collection. (i) The Trust has organized Meditation camps in association with Pyramid meditation Centre. (j) The Trust has also conducted Yoga sessions in association with Vasundhara Performing Arts Center. (k) The Trust has organized Rangapravesha Festivals for 6 students in the year 2010 and 2011. (l) The Trust is committed to organize Dance Festivals like Kishora Bharatha, Nruthyostava,Nruthyapasana on frequent basis. (m) The Trust has been doing Prathibha Puraskara where Budding Artists will be felicitated thus encouraged. (n) The Trust is also engaged in honoring the Artists who has contributed in the various fields, there by motivating the Artistes community.

detailsOfAchievement: Kalagangotri, a theatre group established in 1971 is promoting theatre activities in Karnataka performing plays of different authors and has given over 3000 shows across India and abroad. Kalagangotri is also a mime troupe and has trained 100s of students in mime. Achievements: 1. Has been in theatre from past 46 years. 2. Performed many street plays for social causes. 3. The troupe has been performing from past 36 years the great political satire "Mukyamantri" and has seen over 600 shows. 4. We have give over 1200 mime performances. 5. We have performed a family musical play "Mysooru Mallige" over 225 shows from past 10 years. 6. Troupe has performed Sarswathi samman awarded novel based play "Mandra". 7. Troupe has performed Jnanapeetha awarded novel based play "Mookajjiya Kanasugalu". 8. Troupe is organizing theatre workshops every year to promote theatre activities among school, college children and Youth. 9. Kalagangotri has over 100 ameature artists with senior awarded and recognized artists and also younger generation.

title: Kalamshu Cultural Trust
detailsOfAchievement: Kalamshu is an organisation established for promoting art & cultural development in general. Kalamshu meaning, rays of art, signifies the spread of artistic enlightenment. After a humble beginning, we slowly expanded our activities. We aim at preservation, presentation & promotion of art & culture of our country. In doing so, we also try to reach to economically weaker sections of the society, mentally & physically challenged, creating an environment for them to develop interest & pursue art. Kalamshu has transformed into an institution of good standing with growing reputation, more specifically, in the field of dance and music. We have been in the field for nearly a decade with many sponsored programmes all over Karnataka on prestigious platforms, We have built up a good image in this locality and outside, and well established in this field.
